{{EngvarB|date=June 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Jeff Hendrick | image = Hendrick 2017 (cropped).jpg | image_size = 190 | caption = Hendrick in March 2017 | fullname = Jeffrey Patrick Hendrick<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|1|31|df=y}}<ref name="profile">{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/8586/Jeff-Hendrick/overview|title=Jeff Hendrick|publisher=Premier League|accessdate=27 October 2016}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Dublin]], Ireland | height = 1.85 m<ref name="profile"/> | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] | clubnumber = 13 | youthyears1 = 1998–2008 | youthclubs1 = St. Kevin's Boys | youthyears2 = 2008–2010 | youthclubs2 = [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] | years1 = 2010–2016 | years2 = 2016– | clubs1 = [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] | clubs2 = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] | caps1 = 196 | goals1 = 22 | caps2 = 89 | goals2 = 6 | nationalyears1 = 2006–2007 | nationalteam1 = Republic of Ireland U15 | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2007–2008 | nationalteam2 = Republic of Ireland U16 | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2008–2009 | nationalteam3 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-17 football team|Republic of Ireland U17]] | nationalcaps3 = 6 | nationalgoals3 = 4 | nationalyears4 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam4 = Republic of Ireland U18 | nationalcaps4 = 4 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam5 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team|Republic of Ireland U19]] | nationalcaps5 = 13 | nationalgoals5 = 1 | nationalyears6 = 2011–2014 | nationalteam6 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-21 football team|Republic of Ireland U21]] | nationalcaps6 = 7 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | nationalyears7 = 2013– | nationalteam7 = [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] | nationalcaps7 = 45 | nationalgoals7 = 1 | club-update = 21:27, 27 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 22:14, 19 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Jeffrey Patrick Hendrick''' (born 31 January 1992) is an Irish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] and the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland national team]].
Hendrick spent his early years with boyhood club St. Kevin's Boys in his native [[Dublin]]. He had a number of unsuccessful trials in England before joining [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]]'s youth academy in 2008. Hendrick made his professional debut in April 2011 after impressive performances with the reserve team led manager [[Nigel Clough]] to include him in the senior setup. He quickly became a regular starter and appeared in the [[2014 Football League Championship play-off Final|2014 Championship play-off final]] where Derby missed out on promotion with a 1–0 loss to [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]]. Hendrick amassed a total of 214 appearances for Derby over seven seasons. He joined newly promoted Premier League side Burnley in August 2016, signing a three-year deal.
Hendrick has represented Ireland at all youth levels. Since his senior international debut in 2013, he has made over 40 appearances for Ireland and represented them at [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Club career== ===Derby County=== ====Early years==== Hendrick joined Derby County as a youth player in 2008 from St Kevin's Boys in Dublin, having overcome [[Osgood-Schlatter disease]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/european-championships/hendrick-my-gaa-career-never-took-off-i-was-always-a-soccer-boy-31293997.html|title=Hendrick: My GAA career never took off, I was always a soccer boy|newspaper=[[Irish Independent]]|first=David|last=Kelly|date=11 June 2015|accessdate=1 September 2016}}</ref> and played regularly for the club's academy side before breaking into the reserve team during the 2009–10 campaign. He made [[2009–10 Derby County F.C. season#Player statistics|one start and seven substitute appearances]] as the club's reserve side successfully captured the [[The Central League#2008.E2.80.93present|2009–10 Central League Central Section title]]. At the end of the season his first involvement with the Derby County first team came on 2 May 2010 as he was an unused substitute in a 2–0 victory over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in the final match of the 2009–10 season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_div_1/8644971.stm|title=Derby 2–0 Cardiff|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=2 May 2010|accessdate=14 September 2016}}</ref> A few weeks later, on 8 July 2010, he signed his first professional contract, alongside four other Derby County academy graduates, including fellow Republic of Ireland Youth international [[Ryan Connolly]] and future [[League of Ireland]] player [[Graham Kelly (footballer, born 1991)|Graham Kelly]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2087069,00.html|title=Academy Five sign professional deals |publisher=Derby County F.C. |date=8 July 2010 |accessdate=24 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100710134346/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10270~2087069%2C00.html |archivedate=10 July 2010 |df= }}</ref>
Hendrick played a more significant role in Derby's reserve side during the 2010–11 season, making [[2010–11 Derby County F.C. season#Player statistics|17 starts in all competitions and scoring 9 goals]], including a [[Hat-trick#Association football|hat-trick]] in a 14–1 victory over [[Shirebrook Town F.C.|Shirebrook Town]] in the [[Derbyshire Senior Cup]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/rams-rack-goals-cruise-victory-senior-cup-encounter/story-11604375-detail/story.html|title=Rams rack up the goals as they cruise to victory in Senior Cup encounter|newspaper=[[Derby Telegraph]]|date=6 January 2011|accessdate=24 April 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150612171921/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Rams-rack-goals-cruise-victory-Senior-Cup-encounter/story-11604375-detail/story.html|archivedate=12 June 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and a [[2 (number)#In sports|brace]] in a 5–0 win over [[Buxton F.C.|Buxton]] in the final of the same competition.<ref name="seniorcup">{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2343232,00.html|title=Rams lift the Senior Cup |publisher=Derby County F.C. |date=20 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110423011817/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10270~2343232%2C00.html |archivedate=23 April 2011 |accessdate=24 April 2011 |df= }}</ref> Throughout the campaign, Hendrick impressed enough to earn a contract extension at Derby, which he signed in January 2011 to take him through until Summer 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fai.ie/ireland/news/hendrick-and-connolly-agree-new-derby-deals|title=Hendrick and Connolly agree new Derby deals|publisher=[[Football Association of Ireland]]|date=20 January 2011|accessdate=24 April 2011}}</ref>
====2011–2013==== Approaching the end of the 2010–11 campaign, Derby manager [[Nigel Clough]] stated his desire to give Hendrick a run in the first team, stating "(He's) progressed and done well this season...we would love to see him in the team for three or four games."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/clough-keen-duo-chance-rams/story-11605160-detail/story.html|title=Nigel Clough is keen to give young duo a chance for Rams before season ends|newspaper=Derby Telegraph|date=22 April 2011|accessdate=24 April 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141108193648/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Clough-keen-duo-chance-Rams/story-11605160-detail/story.html|archivedate=8 November 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Hendrick made his debut in the following match on 23 April 2011, as an 80th-minute replacement for [[Robbie Savage]] in a 4–2 home defeat to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10270~52424,00.html |title=Derby County 2 – 4 Burnley |publisher=Derby County F.C. |date=23 April 2011 |accessdate=24 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110425233456/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10270~52424%2C00.html |archivedate=25 April 2011 |df= }}</ref>
Ahead of the [[2011–12 Derby County F.C. season|2011–12 season]], manager Nigel Clough stated that Hendrick would feature in the Derby County first team squad more often.<ref name="11/12">{{cite web|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/hendrick-future-knocks-door-rams/story-12905468-detail/story.html|title=Hendrick one for future as he knocks on door at Rams|newspaper=Derby Telegraph|date=8 July 2011|accessdate=21 July 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141108190426/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Hendrick-future-knocks-door-Rams/story-12905468-detail/story.html|archivedate=8 November 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He was allocated the squad number of 23.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2396288,00.html |title=Squad Numbers Confirmed |publisher=Derby County F.C. |date=19 July 2011 |accessdate=21 July 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110720111707/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10270~2396288%2C00.html |archivedate=20 July 2011 |df= }}</ref> Despite missing the majority of Derby's pre-season due to his call-up to the [[2011 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|European under-19 tournament]],<ref name="11/12" /> Hendrick was involved in first team duty from the start of the campaign, making substitute appearances in the season's opening two matches, against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]] and [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]. He then claimed a place in the starting line-up from the third match (a 1–0 win at [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]]) onward. He scored his first professional goal in his fifth start of the season, claiming the winner in a 2–1 victory at [[Derby County F.C.–Nottingham Forest F.C. rivalry|local rivals]] [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_div_1/14864055.stm|title=Nott'm Forest 1–2 Derby County|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 September 2011|accessdate=17 September 2011}}</ref> His performance earned him a place in the Championship Team of the Week<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2456295,00.html |title=Hero Jeff named in Team of the Week |publisher=Derby County F.C. |date=20 September 2011 |accessdate=28 September 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110924182056/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10270~2456295%2C00.html |archivedate=24 September 2011 |df= }}</ref> and his rich vein of form followed into the next match, a 3–0 thumping of [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]], in which Hendrick grabbed his first goal at [[Pride Park Stadium|Pride Park]] and secured a second consecutive Team of the Week place.<ref name="millwallhometotw">{{cite web|url=http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2465381,00.html|title=Trio rewarded with Team of the Week spots|publisher=Derby County F.C.|date=28 September 2011|accessdate=28 September 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160820185118/http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2465381,00.html#|archive-date=20 August 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Hendrick's form saw him linked with switches to Premier League duo [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] and [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref name="premierlinks">{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/aston-villa-west-bromwich-albion-3314957|title=Derby midfielder a target for Prem clubs|newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]]|date=8 October 2011|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref> The speculation saw Derby enter into contract talks with the midfielder over a new four-year deal.<ref name="premierlinks" /> However, his form tailed off badly (as did Derby's) over the subsequent six weeks, culminating in his substitution in a 2–0 home defeat to [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on 19 November 2011, the first time in his young career he had been removed from a match early after being in the starting eleven, with Clough suggesting that the contract talks and Hendrick getting "[[Sports agent#Role|people]]" had had a negative effect on his game.<ref name="peoplenow">{{cite news|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/boss-blames-contract-talks-hendrick-dip-form/story-13909785-detail/story.html|title=Boss blames contract talks for Hendrick dip in form|newspaper=Derby Telegraph|date=21 November 2011|accessdate=29 July 2016}}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> The following month, the Dublin native signed a new three-and-a-half-year contract, extending his stay at the Pride Park club until the summer of 2015.<ref name="contract">{{cite web|url=http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2538477,00.html|title=Hendrick Pens New Rams Deal|publisher=Derby County F.C.|date=10 December 2011|accessdate=12 December 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160820175821/http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2538477,00.html#|archive-date=20 August 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Hendrick missed Derby's Christmas and New Year programme of fixtures with an ankle ligament injury in a 1–0 defeat against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]].<ref name="2011injury">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/16284131|title=Derby's Jeff Hendrick ruled out until January|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 December 2011|accessdate=18 April 2012}}</ref> Hendrick returned to the first team squad as an unused substitute in a 1–0 win against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on 14 January 2012,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/16453637|title=Derby 2–0 Coventry|publisher=BBC Sport|date=14 January 2012|accessdate=18 April 2012}}</ref> returning to playing action a week later in the 0–0 draw at [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] as a 47th-minute substitute.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/16559443|title=Burnley 0–0 Derby|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 January 2012|accessdate=18 April 2012}}</ref> He started every match for the remainder of the season after this fixture, displacing [[James Bailey (footballer)|James Bailey]] in central midfield. He scored his third goal of the season in a 3–2 home win against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 24 March.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/17412056|title=Derby 3–2 Crystal Palace|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 March 2012|accessdate=18 April 2012}}</ref> Hendrick's form throughout the season was rewarded when he won the club's Sammy Crooks Young Player of the Year award.<ref name="YPOTY">{{cite web|url=http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2751423,00.html |title=Bryson Claims The Jack Stamps Trophy |publisher=Derby County F.C. |date=21 May 2012 |accessdate=27 November 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160820184747/http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10270~2751423%2C00.html |archivedate=20 August 2016 |df= }}</ref>
Hendrick started the [[2012–13 Derby County F.C. season|2012–13 season]] in the starting eleven but after poor performances and scoring only once in his first 17 matches, he was dropped for [[Michael Jacobs (footballer)|Michael Jacobs]]. However, he regained his place shortly after due to an injury picked up by [[Craig Bryson]] after admitting his poor performances in mid-December.<ref name="poorform">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/20682693|title=Jeff Hendrick admits Derby County struggles|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 December 2012|accessdate=18 December 2012}}</ref> Hendrick's form improved<ref name="poorform"/> and he scored his second goal of the season in a 2–0 win at [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on 15 December 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.breakingnews.ie/sport/soccer/hendrick-strikes-for-derby-578006.html|title=Hendrick strikes for Derby|publisher=BreakingNews.ie|date=15 December 2012|accessdate=18 December 2012}}</ref> Hendrick started 2013 in good form, scoring three goals in the opening three matches,<ref name="3goals2013">{{cite news|url=http://www.herald.ie/sport/soccer/jeff-ramming-trap-door-28965152.html|title=Jeff Ram-ming Trap door|newspaper=[[The Herald (Ireland)|The Herald]]|first=Aidan|last=Fitzmaurice|date=16 January 2013|accessdate=21 January 2013}}</ref> including a goal against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] in a 3–1 home win which was later named Derby's ''Goal of the Season''.<ref name="goaloftheseason13">{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/keogh-named-club-player-of-the-year-803602.aspx|title=Keogh Named Club Player of the Year|publisher=Derby County F.C.|date=2 May 2013|accessdate=4 May 2013}}</ref> Former Derby teammate [[Kevin Kilbane]] stated that Hendrick had the ability to play in the Premier League.<ref name="3goals2013"/> He scored again on 9 February 2013, in a 2–2 draw against [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/21311544|title=Sheffield Wed 2–2 Derby|publisher=BBC Sport|date=9 February 2013|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref> He earned further praise for his performance in Derby's 3–0 win at home to [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on 29 March, where he scored the opening goal.<ref name="briscpraise">{{cite web|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/garner-hails-hendrick-bryson-derby-county-beat/story-18563527-detail/story.html|title=Garner hails Hendrick and Bryson after Derby beat Bristol City|newspaper=Derby Telegraph|first=Steve|last=Nicholson|date=30 March 2013|accessdate=31 March 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150923230831/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Garner-hails-Hendrick-Bryson-Derby-County-beat/story-18563527-detail/story.html|archivedate=23 September 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Hendrick finished the season runner-up for the Derby County Player of the Season Award and named the 58th best player in the [[2012–13 Football League Championship]] by the Actim Index.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/derbys-six-of-the-best-826899.aspx|title=Derby's Six of the Best|publisher=Derby County F.C.|date=16 May 2013|accessdate=18 May 2013}}</ref>
Ahead of the [[2013–14 Derby County F.C. season|2013–14 season]], Hendrick was set to compete with [[Craig Bryson]], [[Paul Coutts]] and [[Will Hughes]] for a starting berth, with Nigel Clough stating that rotation could be utilised.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Nigel-Clough-pondering-midfield-dilemma-Derby/story-19552961-detail/story.html|title=Nigel Clough still pondering midfield dilemma for Derby County|newspaper=Derby Telegraph|first1=Peter|last1=Green|first2=Steve|last2=Nicholson|date=23 July 2013|accessdate=30 July 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130726153408/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Nigel-Clough-pondering-midfield-dilemma-Derby/story-19552961-detail/story.html|archivedate=26 July 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Hendrick started in Derby's first five matches, before succumbing to a chipped ankle bone injury in the 3–0 win at [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] in late August, with a scan revealing damage worse than expected<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Growing-concern-Derby-County-Jeff-Hendrick-injury/story-19725190-detail/story.html|title=Growing concern for Derby County over Jeff Hendrick injury|newspaper=Derby Telegraph|first1=Colston|last1=Crawford|first2=Steve|last2=Nicholson|date=30 August 2013|accessdate=30 August 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130902021838/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Growing-concern-Derby-County-Jeff-Hendrick-injury/story-19725190-detail/story.html|archivedate=2 September 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and was later ruled out for 12 weeks.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Derby-County-s-Jeff-Hendrick-face-months/story-19737388-detail/story.html|title=Derby County's Jeff Hendrick could face three months out|newspaper=Derby Telegraph|first1=Peter|last1=Green|first2=Steve|last2=Nicholson|date=2 September 2013|accessdate=2 September 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150403000011/http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/Derby-County-s-Jeff-Hendrick-face-months/story-19737388-detail/story.html|archivedate=3 April 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
====2014–2016==== Hendrick scored four league goals during the 2013–14 season, helping Derby reach the [[2014 Football League play-offs#Championship|play-offs]].<ref name=sb1314>{{Soccerbase season|54428|2013|name=Jeff Hendrick|accessdate=29 October 2014}}</ref> In the play-off semi-final, Derby came up against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]. On 11 May 2014, Hendrick scored in the 4–1 home victory in the second leg as Brighton were defeated 6–2 on [[Two-legged tie|aggregate]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/27273132|title=Derby County 4–1 Brighton & Hove Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Michael|last=Emons|date=11 May 2014|accessdate=27 November 2016}}</ref> On 24 May, he played in the play-off final as Derby lost 1–0 to Queens Park Rangers thereby missing out on promotion to the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/27452294|title=Derby County 0–1 Queens Park Rangers|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Paul|last=Fletcher|date=24 May 2014|accessdate=27 November 2016}}</ref>
On 26 June 2014, Hendrick agreed a new four-year contract with Derby, which would keep him at the club until the end of the 2017–18 season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/jeff-hendrick-signs-a-new-four-year-deal-with-derby-county-1690297.aspx|title=Jeff Hendrick Signs A New Four Year Deal With Derby County|publisher=Derby County F.C.|accessdate=26 June 2014}}</ref> The [[2014–15 Derby County F.C. season|2014–15 season]] was his most fruitful to date in terms of goalscoring as he netted a total of nine goals in 47 matches in all competitions.<ref name=sb1415>{{Soccerbase season|54428|2014|name=Jeff Hendrick|accessdate=29 October 2014}}</ref>
Hendrick scored his first goal of the [[2015–16 Derby County F.C. season|2015–16 season]] in a 2–2 draw away at [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] on 29 December.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35154784|title=Leeds United 2–2 Derby County|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Nathan|last=Middleton|date=29 December 2015|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref> He scored his second of the season in the 3–1 away win against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] on 20 February 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35566787|title=Brentford 1–3 Derby County|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 February 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref> After missing seven league matches due to a thigh injury, Hendrick returned for the final league match against Ipswich on 7 May but was an unused substitute.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/derby-county-team-news-rams-unchanged-face/story-29242473-detail/story.html|title=Derby County team news: Rams unchanged to face Ipswich Town, Jeff Hendrick makes the bench|newspaper=Derby Telegraph|first=Colston|last=Crawford|date=7 May 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Derby finished in fifth place in the Championship and qualified for the [[2016 Football League play-offs#Championship|play-offs]] where they would meet Hull City in the semi-final.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/derby-county-backing-rams-head-championship-play/story-29219496-detail/story.html|title=Derby County: We're backing the Rams as they head to the Championship play-offs|newspaper=Derby Telegraph|first=Amy|last=Guard|date=3 May 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Hendrick was again an unused substitute in the semi-final first leg but returned to the starting line-up for the second leg and played the full 90 minutes as Derby lost 3–2 on aggregate to the ''Tigers''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36253545|title=Hull City 0–2 Derby County (3–2 agg)|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Gary|last=Smee|date=17 May 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref>
Hendrick's [[2016–17 Derby County F.C. season|2016–17 season]] did not get off to a good start as he picked up a hamstring injury in a 2–0 loss to [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 13 August.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/bryson-we-didnt-deal-with-the-early-setbacks-3246097.aspx|title=Bryson: "We Didn't Deal With The Early Setbacks"|publisher=Derby County F.C.|date=13 August 2016|accessdate=14 August 2016}}</ref>
===Burnley=== ====2016–17 season==== On 31 August 2016, Hendrick joined Premier League side [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] for a club record £10.5 million fee on a three-year deal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37230194|title=Jeff Hendrick: Derby midfielder joins Burnley for club record fee|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 August 2016|accessdate=31 August 2016}}</ref> He made his debut on 10 September, coming on as a 75th-minute substitute in a 1–1 draw at home to Hull City.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37263920|title=Burnley 1–1 Hull City|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=10 September 2016}}</ref> He made his first start for Burnley on 17 September, playing the full 90 minutes in a 3–0 away defeat against reigning Premier League champions [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the42.ie/leicester-city-burnley-premier-league-2984723-Sep2016/|title=Hendrick can't prevent Burnley defeat on first league start as Leicester record signing shines|work=The42|publisher=[[TheJournal.ie]]|date=17 September 2016|accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37325839|title=Leicester City 3–0 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Ian|last=Woodcock|date=17 September 2016|accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> Nine days later, Hendrick netted his first goal for Burnley in a 2–0 home win over Watford with a header from a [[Steven Defour]] cross.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37404133|title=Burnley 2–0 Watford|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mandeep|last=Sanghera|date=26 September 2016|accessdate=26 September 2016}}</ref> He scored his second goal for his new club on 10 December 2016 with a 25-yard volley in a 3–2 home victory over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38193053|title=Burnley 3–2 Bournemouth|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Matt|last=Davis|date=10 December 2016|accessdate=10 December 2016}}</ref> Hendrick's strike was nominated for [[BBC Goal of the Month|Goal of the Month]]; it came third in the public vote, behind strikes by [[Alexis Sánchez]] in second and [[Henrikh Mkhitaryan]] in first.<ref name="gotm-dec2016">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/38480679|title=Mkhitaryan wins December goal of the month|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 January 2017|accessdate=2 January 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170102002649/https://www.bbc.com/sport/live/football/38480679|archivedate=2 January 2017}}</ref> On 4 February 2017, he was [[Fouls and misconduct (association football)#Red card (dismissal)|sent off]] against Watford in the sixth minute for a two-footed challenge on [[José Holebas]] as Burnley were defeated 2–1 at [[Vicarage Road]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/38779314|title=Watford 2–1 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Mike|last=Whalley|date=4 February 2017|accessdate=5 February 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== [[File:David luiz Jeff Hendrick tussle.jpg|thumb|upright|Hendrick playing for [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] at [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in August 2017]]
Hendrick opened his 2017–18 goalscoring account on 1 October away at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], finishing off a move that consisted of 24 passes. Burnley would go on to win 1–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41376505|title=Everton 0–1 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Kal|last=Sajad|date=1 October 2017|accessdate=9 January 2018}}</ref> He netted his second goal of the season in a 1–0 home victory over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on 30 October in what was [[Sean Dyche]]'s fifth anniversary as Burnley manager.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41717330|title=Burnley 1–0 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Neil|last=Johnston|date=30 October 2017|accessdate=9 January 2018}}</ref> Hendrick had a goal ruled out for offside and was denied a clear penalty in the 0–0 draw at [[Huddersfield Town F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on 30 December. Huddersfield goalkeeper [[Jonas Lössl]] later admitted he made contact with Hendrick; "I touched him. I spoke to the referee and I said there was contact. I didn't do it on purpose, but there was contact. I told the referee after but it was his decision."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42410952|title=Huddersfield Town 0–0 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Kris|last=Holland|date=30 December 2017|accessdate=9 January 2018}}</ref>
Burnley finished seventh in the [[2017–18 Premier League]] and qualified for the second qualifying round of the [[2018–19 UEFA Europa League]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44018738|title=Burnley secure European football for first time in 51 years|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 May 2018|accessdate=26 July 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 20 June 2018, it was announced that Burnley would face [[Scottish Premiership]] club [[Aberdeen F.C.|Aberdeen]] in the second qualifying round of the [[UEFA Europa League]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.irishexaminer.com/breakingnews/sport/soccer/burnley-drawn-to-face-aberdeen-in-europa-league-qualifying-850078.html|title=Burnley drawn to face Aberdeen in Europa League qualifying|newspaper=Irish Examiner|agency=Press Association|date=20 June 2018|accessdate=28 July 2018}}</ref> Hendrick made his Europa League debut when he started on 26 July 2018 at [[Pittodrie Stadium]], [[Aberdeen]]. He was replaced by [[Sam Vokes]] in the 67th minute with Vokes eventually going on to score the equaliser to make it 1–1 in the 80th minute. The match ended 1–1, meaning Burnley had the advantage of an away goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44938522|title=Aberdeen 1–1 Burnley: Gary Mackay-Steven and Sam Vokes trade goals|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Tom|last=English|date=26 July 2018|accessdate=27 July 2018}}</ref>
His first goal of the [[2018–19 Burnley F.C. season|2018–19 season]] came on 26 August in a 4–2 away defeat against newly promoted [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45237327|title=Fulham 4–2 Burnley|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Harry|last=Poole|date=26 August 2018|accessdate=30 September 2018}}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== Born in [[Dublin]], Hendrick has been capped by Ireland at under-15, under-16, under-17, under-18, under-19 and under-21 levels.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2104488,00.html |title=Youngsters Get Ireland Call-Ups |publisher=Derby County F.C. |date=29 July 2010 |accessdate=24 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100729201926/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10270~2104488%2C00.html |archivedate=29 July 2010 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.joe.ie/uncategorized/ready-to-burst-onto-the-scene-jeff-hendrick/46303|title=Ready to Burst onto the Scene: Jeff Hendrick|publisher=JOE.ie|accessdate=14 August 2016}}</ref> He was shortlisted for the [[FAI International Football Awards#Under 17 International Player of the Year|Republic of Ireland under-17 level]] International Player of the Year award in July 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fai.ie/ireland/news/fai-international-football-award-nominees-announced|title=FAI International Football Award nominees announced|publisher=Football Association of Ireland|date=5 August 2010|accessdate=14 August 2016}}</ref> He played a key role in the U19s successful [[2011 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship elite qualification#Group 4|2011 European Under-19 Championship qualifying campaign]] putting in a "string of impressive displays" as he featured in all three group matches and notched the only goal of the match in a 1–0 win over [[Poland national under-19 football team|Poland U19s]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2368102,00.html|title=Qualification Joy For Hendrick |publisher=Derby County F.C. |date=31 May 2011 |accessdate=21 July 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110601170708/http://www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10270~2368102%2C00.html |archivedate= 1 June 2011 |df= }}</ref> In July 2011, Hendrick was named in the [[2011 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship squads#.C2.A0Republic of Ireland|squad]] for the [[2011 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|European Under-19 Championships]].<ref name="11/12"/> He started in all four of Ireland's matches at the tournament as they were knocked out in the semi-final stage to [[Spain national under-19 football team|Spain]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2405594,00.html|title=Jeff Set To Return After Ireland U19 Defeat|publisher=Derby County F.C.|date=10 August 2011|accessdate=14 August 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160820171451/http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2405594,00.html#|archive-date=20 August 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Upon his return from the tournament, Hendrick was called up to the [[Republic of Ireland national under-21 football team|Irish U21]] squad for the first time.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2410730,00.html|title=Hendrick Called Up To Ireland U21 Squad|publisher=Derby County F.C.|date=17 August 2011|accessdate=17 August 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160820181419/http://origin-www.dcfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10270~2410730,00.html#|archive-date=20 August 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made his debut in a 2–1 victory against [[Austria national under-21 football team|Austria U21s]] on 9 August 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fai.ie/ireland/news/brady-on-fire-in-under-21-victory|title=Brady on fire in Under-21 victory|publisher=Football Association of Ireland|date=9 August 2011|accessdate=14 August 2011}}</ref>
===Senior=== In January 2013, it was reported that [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Ireland]] head coach [[Giovanni Trappatoni]] was watching Hendrick with the view to giving the player his first call-up to the senior side<ref name="3goals2013"/> and later in the month Hendrick was called up to the senior squad to play in a friendly against [[Poland national football team|Poland]] on 6 February 2013.<ref name=irelandcallup>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/league-of-ireland/andrews-injury-opens-door-for-hendricks-first-senior-callup-3358252.html|title=Andrews injury opens door for Hendrick's first senior call-up|newspaper=Irish Independent|first=Ruaidhri|last=O'Connor|date=21 January 2013|accessdate=21 January 2013}}</ref> Hendrick came on as a 71st-minute substitute for [[James McCarthy (footballer)|James McCarthy]] in the 2–0 win and provided an assist for [[Wes Hoolahan]] for Ireland's second goal in this match, showing fantastic composure in doing so with a perfectly weighted pass.<ref name="firstcap">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/21313667|title=Republic of Ireland of Ireland 2–0 Poland|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 February 2013|accessdate=6 February 2013}}</ref> Hendrick received his first Ireland start in his fourth cap, in a match against World and European Champions [[Spain national football team|Spain]] on 12 June 2013 at the [[Yankee Stadium]] in New York City.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/22827856|title=Spain beat Republic of Ireland in New York friendly|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 June 2013|accessdate=12 June 2013}}</ref> He played a starring role in the [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|Euro 2016 qualifier]] against [[Georgia national football team|Georgia]] in the Aviva Stadium on 7 September 2015. His run and nutmeg set up an easy finish for [[Jonathan Walters]] which proved to be the only goal of the match.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/34063056|title=Republic of Ireland 1–0 Georgia|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 September 2015|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref>
Hendrick started in all four of Ireland's matches at [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/euro-2016/brian-kerr-ireland-bid-adieu-to-euro-2016-but-discover-their-soul-34835660.html|title=Brian Kerr: Ireland bid adieu to Euro 2016 but discover their soul|newspaper=Irish Independent|date=27 June 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref> He hit the crossbar against Sweden<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the42.ie/jeff-hendrick-comes-of-age-international-stage-1409169-Jun2016/|title=Ireland's Jeff Hendrick comes of age on the international stage|work=The 42|publisher=TheJournal.ie|first=Paul|last=Fennessy|date=14 June 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref> and was unlucky not to score against Italy.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.irishexaminer.com/euro2016/euro2016-news/cheat-sheet-how-ireland-dominated-italy-but-still-did-it-the-hard-way-741333.html|title=Cheat sheet: How Ireland dominated Italy but still did it the hard way|newspaper=[[Irish Examiner]]|date=22 June 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160623161737/http://www.irishexaminer.com/euro2016/euro2016-news/cheat-sheet-how-ireland-dominated-italy-but-still-did-it-the-hard-way-741333.html|archivedate=23 June 2016}}</ref> He earned much praise for his performances as he played a vital role in securing qualification to the knockout stages of the championship.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/european-championship/74/blog/post/2892530/republic-of-ireland-total-team-display-to-shock-italy-at-euro-2016|title=Robbie Brady, Jeff Hendrick superb as Republic of Ireland stun Italy 1–0|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|first=Ewan|last=Mackenna|date=22 June 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rte.ie/sport/euro-2016/2016/0623/797569-keane-hails-brady-and-hendrick/|title=Keane singles out Hendrick and Brady for praise after Ireland win|publisher=[[RTÉ Sport]]|first=Glenn|last=Mason|date=23 June 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the42.ie/ireland-jeff-hendrick-italy-euro-2016-robbie-keane-2840580-Jun2016/|title='I told Tottenham to sign him years ago!' – Keane hails Hendrick as one of Euro 2016's best midfielders|work=The42|publisher=TheJournal.ie|first=Ben|last=Blake|date=23 June 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref> Ireland eventually lost 2–1 to hosts [[France national football team|France]] in the Round of 16.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36569511|title=France 2–1 Republic of Ireland|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Shamoon|last=Hafez|date=26 June 2016|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref>
Hendrick scored his first goal for Ireland on 5 September 2016. He opened the scoring in the third minute in the 2–2 away draw against [[Serbia national football team|Serbia]] in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2018 World Cup qualifying]] match with a low shot just outside the penalty area which was deflected in off [[Branislav Ivanović]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rte.ie/sport/soccer/2016/0905/814414-daryl-murphy-snatches-point-for-ireland-in-serbia/|title=Daryl Murphy snatches point for the Republic of Ireland in Serbia|publisher=RTÉ Sport|first=Ed|last=Leahy|date=5 September 2016|accessdate=6 September 2016}}</ref>
==Style of play== {{Quote box|width=20%|align=right|quoted=1|quote=Jeff can play anywhere across the midfield, I think he can play behind the strikers. Can he sit in and do a holding job? That's not outside his capability.|source=— [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] manager [[Martin O'Neill]] on Hendrick's adaptability.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/international-soccer/if-we-havent-got-the-players-to-compete-it-makes-it-even-more-important-that-we-have-the-right-manager-37318574.html|title=If we haven't got the players to compete, it makes it even more important that we have the right manager|newspaper=Irish Independent|first=Aidan|last=O'Hara|date=15 September 2018|accessdate=30 September 2018}}</ref>}}
Hendrick is known for being very hard-working, tactically aware and for his ability to pass the ball successfully.<ref name="F365">{{cite web|url=https://www.football365.com/news/forensically-watching-ordinary-player-jeff-hendrick|title=Forensically watching an ordinary player: Jeff Hendrick|publisher=Football365|first=Peter|last=Goldstein|date=30 March 2018|accessdate=30 September 2018}}</ref> He is capable of playing as a central midfielder or an attacking midfielder behind the striker.<ref name="F365"/> His big strength is winning second balls from aerial duels and keeping the attack going in advanced positions.<ref name="F365"/> Owing to his lack of proficiency in scoring goals, Hendrick's most frequent task is recycling possession high up the pitch to create chances for his teammates.<ref name="F365"/>
==Career statistics== [[File:Jeff Hendrick (crop).png|thumb|upright|Hendrick ''(wearing No.13)'' after the match against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in October 2016]]
